metas.name: Parks and Recreation
metas.description: You enjoyed the uplifting workplace comedy and character-driven humor of 'Ted Lasso' and the smart, witty dialogue of 'The Good Place'. Parks and Rec offers a similar blend of optimistic characters and hilarious situations, with a strong focus on friendship and community.

metas.name: Community
metas.description: Given your appreciation for meta-humor, pop culture references, and ensemble cast dynamics in shows like 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and 'The Simpsons', 'Community' is a perfect fit. It's a smart, inventive sitcom that constantly plays with genre and expectations.

metas.name: What We Do in the Shadows
metas.description: Your enjoyment of quirky, character-focused comedies like 'Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency' and 'Peep Show' suggests you'll love this mockumentary about vampire roommates. It's absurd, hilarious, and surprisingly heartwarming at times.

metas.name: Abbott Elementary
metas.description: Similar to 'Ted Lasso' and 'The Good Place', this show offers a heartwarming and genuinely funny look at dedicated individuals in a challenging environment. It's an optimistic and charming workplace comedy.

metas.name: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
metas.description: You like sitcoms with strong comedic writing and lovable characters, as seen in 'Scrubs' and 'The Simpsons'. Brooklyn Nine-Nine delivers fast-paced humor, a great ensemble cast, and surprisingly heartfelt moments, all within a police procedural framework.

metas.name: Schitt's Creek
metas.description: This show offers a similar heartwarming character arc and comedic journey to what you likely enjoyed in 'Ted Lasso'. It starts with a fish-out-of-water premise and evolves into a deeply beloved and funny exploration of family and self-discovery.

metas.name: Bojack Horseman
metas.description: While it has its darker moments, you've shown a taste for intelligent, layered comedy with elements of existentialism, as seen in 'Master of None' and 'Atlanta'. Bojack Horseman is a masterclass in animated satire with surprising emotional depth.

metas.name: The Marvelous Mrs. Maisel
metas.description: Your appreciation for witty dialogue and character-driven comedy, evident in 'Master of None' and 'Atlanta', will find a perfect match here. The show is visually stunning, fast-paced, and consistently funny, with a charismatic lead.

metas.name: Kim's Convenience
metas.description: If you enjoyed the family dynamics and gentle humor of 'The Simpsons' and the cultural commentary in 'Goodness Gracious Me', you'll likely find 'Kim's Convenience' very appealing. It's a charming and funny look at a Korean-Canadian family running a convenience store.

metas.name: Avenue 5
metas.description: Given your enjoyment of sci-fi comedy with a touch of absurdity like 'The Good Place' and 'Futurama', 'Avenue 5' offers a hilarious and satirical look at space tourism gone wrong. It's by the creator of Veep, so expect sharp wit.

metas.name: Space Force
metas.description: Fans of 'The Office' and 'Parks and Recreation' often enjoy the workplace comedy silliness of 'Space Force'. If you liked the comedic ensemble and slightly absurd premise of 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia', this might be a good fit.

metas.name: Disenchantment
metas.description: From the creator of 'The Simpsons' and 'Futurama', this animated fantasy comedy offers a similar blend of humor, adventure, and character development in a unique world, which you've clearly enjoyed.

metas.name: Bluey
metas.description: Despite being a children's show, 'Bluey' is universally beloved for its incredible heart, imaginative play, and subtle humor that resonates with adults. If you liked the feel-good aspects of 'Ted Lasso' and the lightheartedness of 'The Good Place', this is pure comfort.

metas.name: Crazy Ex-Girlfriend
metas.description: This show is a genre-bending delight, blending comedy, drama, and musical numbers with insightful commentary on mental health. If you enjoyed the smart writing and emotional depth in 'Atlanta' and 'Master of None', this is a must-watch.

metas.name: Silicon Valley
metas.description: If you appreciate witty, fast-paced comedy and clever satire, similar to 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and 'Peep Show', 'Silicon Valley' offers a hilarious look at the tech industry with relatable characters navigating absurd situations.

metas.name: Trial & Error
metas.description: This mockumentary legal comedy delivers quirky characters and absurd plotlines, much like 'Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency' and 'What We Do in the Shadows'. It's a lighthearted and fun watch.

metas.name: The IT Crowd
metas.description: For fans of British humor and workplace comedies like 'Peep Show' and 'Goodness Gracious Me', 'The IT Crowd' offers a delightful blend of geek culture and laugh-out-loud situations. It's wonderfully silly and quotable.

metas.name: Young Offenders
metas.description: If you enjoyed the comedic crime capers and camaraderie of 'Brassic', this Irish series about two teenage friends getting into trouble offers a similar charm, humor, and heart. It's a fun, energetic watch.

metas.name: Wellington Paranormal
metas.description: A spin-off from 'What We Do in the Shadows', this mockumentary follows two bumbling police officers investigating supernatural events. If you enjoyed the quirky humor and deadpan delivery of 'Dirk Gently' and 'What We Do in the Shadows', this is a great choice.

metas.name: The Other Two
metas.description: This comedy offers sharp satire on fame and the entertainment industry, with relatable characters and excellent writing, similar to what you might have enjoyed in 'Atlanta' and 'Master of None'. It's a fresh and funny take.

metas.name: Letterkenny
metas.description: For a unique brand of quick-witted, observational humor with a strong sense of character and community, 'Letterkenny' is fantastic. If you liked the dialogue in 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and 'Peep Show', you'll appreciate this Canadian gem.

metas.name: Ghosts (UK)
metas.description: This show provides a wonderful blend of supernatural comedy and heartwarming character interactions, much like 'The Good Place' and 'Dirk Gently's Holistic Detective Agency'. The humor is gentle and clever.

metas.name: Inside No. 9
metas.description: If you enjoy dark comedy with clever twists and turns, and appreciate the writing in 'Peep Show' and 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia', 'Inside No. 9' offers anthology episodes that are consistently surprising and often hilarious, with a touch of the macabre.

metas.name: Parenthood
metas.description: For a show that delivers feel-good family drama and strong emotional arcs, much like the positive aspects of 'Ted Lasso', 'Parenthood' is a highly-rated and heartwarming series that focuses on the complexities and joys of family life.

metas.name: Fleabag
metas.description: This critically acclaimed comedy offers sharp wit, vulnerability, and a unique narrative style, which might appeal to your appreciation for shows like 'Master of None' and 'Atlanta'. It's hilarious and emotionally resonant.

metas.name: Bobs Burgers
metas.description: If you enjoy animated sitcoms with quirky characters and a warm, supportive family dynamic, similar to 'The Simpsons' and 'Futurama', 'Bob's Burgers' offers a consistently funny and charming experience with lovable protagonists.

metas.name: Futurama
metas.description: While you have watched Futurama, it's such a strong match for your tastes in animated sci-fi comedy and clever writing that it's worth re-mentioning if you ever feel like a rewatch. It aligns perfectly with your enjoyment of 'The Good Place' and 'Rick and Morty'.

metas.name: Welcome to Wrexham
metas.description: This docuseries about Hollywood actors buying a Welsh football club offers a fantastic blend of humor, heart, and genuine underdog spirit. It's feel-good reality television that's surprisingly engaging and often hilarious.

metas.name: All Creatures Great and Small
metas.description: This is a pure comfort watch. If you appreciated the uplifting and heartwarming nature of 'Ted Lasso' and enjoy feel-good stories, this charming series about a vet in the Yorkshire Dales is incredibly gentle and joyous.

metas.name: Corner Gas
metas.description: This Canadian sitcom offers gentle, character-driven humor set in a small prairie town. If you enjoyed the lightheartedness of 'The Simpsons' and the relaxed pace of 'MythBusters', 'Corner Gas' is a warm and consistently funny choice.

metas.name: Young Sheldon
metas.description: For a charming, family-friendly comedy that focuses on a brilliant but socially awkward child, similar to the character studies in 'The Simpsons' or the heartwarming elements of 'Ted Lasso', 'Young Sheldon' provides a delightful and funny viewing experience.

metas.name: Taskmaster
metas.description: This is a comedy game show where comedians compete in bizarre tasks. If you enjoy clever humor, improvisational comedy, and lighthearted competition, this show is an absolute riot and a perfect fit for your background viewing needs.

metas.name: Only Murders in the Building
metas.description: This delightful mystery-comedy blends humor, charm, and a clever plot, with fantastic performances. If you enjoyed the witty banter and engaging characters of 'The Good Place' and 'Master of None', you'll love unraveling this cozy mystery.

metas.name: Impractical Jokers
metas.description: This hidden camera prank show is pure, unadulterated fun. If you enjoyed the comedic chaos of 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and want something light and laugh-out-loud, this show delivers consistent hilarity.

metas.name: Upload
metas.description: From the creator of 'The Office', this sci-fi comedy explores an afterlife where people can upload themselves. If you liked the blend of sci-fi and comedy in 'The Good Place' and 'Futurama', 'Upload' offers a smart, funny, and often touching premise.

metas.name: Derry Girls
metas.description: This coming-of-age sitcom set in Northern Ireland during the Troubles is hilariously chaotic and full of heart. If you enjoyed the sharp, irreverent humor of 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia' and 'Brassic', you'll adore the wit and energy of Derry Girls.

metas.name: American Dad!
metas.description: If you enjoy adult animated sitcoms with a satirical edge and recurring character humor like 'The Simpsons' and 'Rick and Morty', 'American Dad!' offers a similar brand of off-the-wall comedy and sci-fi elements.

metas.name: Modern Family
metas.description: This mockumentary sitcom is a masterclass in family comedy, featuring relatable characters and heartwarming moments. If you enjoyed the ensemble dynamics and humor of 'The Simpsons' and the feel-good aspects of 'Ted Lasso', 'Modern Family' is a perfect fit.
